catalog_info.title: Introduction to Quantum Theory of Solids
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Applied Physics 195 or equivalent, and a graduate level quantum mechanics course similar to Physics 251a. (Physics 251b would be helpful and may be taken concurrently.)
catalog_info.description: Electrical, optical, thermal, magnetic, and mechanical properties of solids will be treated based on an atomic scale picture and using the independent electron approximation. Metals, semiconductors, and insulators will be covered, with possible special topics such as superconductivity.
